snippet: As Detroit furloughs municipal workers and struggles to provide basic services, the city’s professional sport teams operate in a vastly different economic world.
abstract: Detroit's professional sport teams, fueled by billionaire owners and lucrative television deals, are thriving even as city struggles to provide basic services amid bankruptcy proceedings; divide is especially apparent in terms of the Detroit Tigers, who have one of highest payrolls in baseball; gap between two worlds has begun to chafe some residents, who point to publicly financed stadiums and inflated player contracts.
lead_paragraph: As Detroit furloughs municipal workers and struggles to provide basic services, the city’s professional sport teams operate in a vastly different economic world.

headline.main: Bankruptcy for Ailing Detroit, but Prosperity for Its Teams
headline.print_headline: Bankruptcy for Ailing Detroit, But Prosperity for Its Teams
